page.title: 04PIREHILL
page.content: The name dates from Saxon times. The hill was a meeting place for the hundred moot and the point where people rallied if they were attacked. Beacons were lit here in times of danger. Stone is still part of the Pirehill Hundred today. Because of its name, Pirehill House was a good place to choose for the County Fire Brigade H.Q. Built in the 1940's it is the control centre of 30 fire stations and 1000 people. It has charge of money, transport, fire investigation and prevention etc. Sixty people work here. The County Chief Fire Officer is based at Pirehill House.
